content:
Diagnosis:
Malignant melanoma right forearm
Breslow thickness 0.9mm, no ulceration, mitotic rate 1/mm2
pT1bN0M0 (AJCC 8th edition)
NRAS Q61R mutation detected

Previous medical history:
Hypertension
Type 2 diabetes

Current medications:
Ramipril 5mg daily
Metformin 1g twice daily

Allergies:
None known

Current situation:
Wide local excision performed 15 March 2024 by Dr [redacted name]
Clear margins achieved (1cm peripheral and deep)
Healing well with no complications

I reviewed [redacted name] today following his recent melanoma surgery. The pathology confirms a 0.9mm Breslow thickness melanoma with no ulceration but presence of mitoses. Molecular testing has detected an NRAS Q61R mutation. Clinical examination today shows a well-healing surgical site with no concerning features. There is no palpable lymphadenopathy and no suspicious skin lesions elsewhere.

I have explained the diagnosis, prognosis and surveillance plan in detail. Given the stage, we will arrange 3-monthly reviews for the first year. I have provided written information about sun protection and skin self-examination. A repeat chest x-ray and LFTs will be arranged prior to next review in 3 months.
